 IN MEMORY OF THE BRAVE AMERICANS
 WHO GAVE THEIR LIVES
 TO ACHIEVE VICTORY IN VIETNAM', [['Now you know why they went with Maya Lin’s wall in the real world!']]), ('Hnrrrrr -- we never happened.', [['So preventing Jon from turning into Dr. Manhattan made the world go back to normal (and a better place!)']]), ('In a minute I¹ll do it again.  And if my aim is true, I¹ll put a bullet through Jon Osterman¹s heart . . . and Dr. Manhattan will never be born.', [['This is Veidt’s evil plan, not blowing up the city and blaming it on aliens!']]), ('The NEWS VENDOR eyes him suspiciously as he passes, then turns up his
 collar and looks pointedly away.  A SMALL BLACK KID, leaning against
 the kiosk', [['This is Benard, the news vendor and Bernie, the comic reader']]), ('LAURIE JUSPECZYK', [['Laurie’s mother Sally Jupiter, the original Silk Spectre was written out.']]), ('Watchmen', [['The team was never “Watchmen”, in the actual comics. The 1970s team was called “Crimebusters”, which was an updated version of the Minutemen from the 1940s.']]), ('HAPPY-FACE BUTTON', [['']]), ('Jesus Christ, it must be Halloween.', [['or they’re cosplayers!']]), ('CAPTAIN METROPOLIS;', [['Interestingly, this character died in 1974 in the original.']]), ('Christ almighty, it’s the goddamned Watchmen!', [['This would have become a internet meme for sure!']])]

title: Fallin'
lyrics:
Fallin’ Lyrics[Verse 1]
I keep on fallin' in
And outta love with you
Sometimes I love ya, sometimes you make me blue
Sometimes I feel good, at times I feel used
Lovin' you, darlin', makes me so confused

[Chorus]
I keep on fallin' in and out
Of love with you
I never loved someone
The way that I'm lovin' you
[Verse 2]
Oh, oh, I never felt this way
How do you give me so much pleasure
And cause me so much pain? (Yeah, yeah)
Just when I think I've taken more than would a fool
I start fallin' back in love with you

[Chorus]
I keep on fallin' in and out
Of love with you
I never loved someone (Oh, someone)
The way that I'm lovin' you (Way I, uh, uh)

[Bridge]
Oh, baby
I, I, I, I'm fallin' (Yeah, yeah, yeah)
I, I, I, I'm fallin'
Fall, fall, fall (Sing)
Fall

[Chorus]
I keep on fallin' in and out (Out)
Of love with you (Love with you)
I never loved someone (I never, loved)
The way that I'm lovin' you (Oh)
I'm fallin' in and out (Yeah)
Of love with you (Of love with you)
I never loved someone (No, no, no)
The way that I'm lovin' you (Uh)
I'm fallin' in and out (Yeah)
Of love with you (Of love with you)
I never loved someone (No, no, no)
The way that I'm lovin' you (Uh)
You might also like[Outro]
What?44Embed
annotation:
[('I keep on fallin’ in and out
 Of love with you
 I never loved someone
 The way that I’m lovin’ you', [["Alicia Keys talked particularly about this hook herself in a Billboard interview in 2001:

[… “Fallin'”] is about the ins and outs of a relationship. Sometimes, you’re completely head-over-heels in love with someone, and sometimes you can’t stand that person. You fall in and out, sometimes it goes back and forth, and that’s just what relationships are about."]])]

title: Typewriter
lyrics:
Typewriter Lyrics[Intro]
There we go, ladies and gentlemen
Past all of the technical difficulties
That we have thus forth experienced
I will let you into my laboratory filled with many things

annotation:
[('I keep on fallin’ in and out
 Of love with you

 The way that I’m lovin’ you', [["Alicia Keys talked particularly about this hook herself in a Billboard interview in 2001:

[… “Fallin'”] is about the ins and outs of a relationship. Sometimes, you’re completely head-over-heels in love with someone, and sometimes you can’t stand that person. You fall in and out, sometimes it goes back and forth, and that’s just what relationships are about."]])]

annotation:
[('It’s so hard to just let go (Hard, just let go)
 When this is the one and only love I’ve ever known (Only)', [['An interpolation of the song entitled, “It’s So Hard to Say Goodbye to Yesterday”, popularized after Boyz II Men did a cover of it.

Vocally, when Alicia Keys sings, “It’s so hard,” it may sound somewhat similar to how Boyz II Men sing it. Take a listen:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dtkbfkmW808#t=124

(In contrast, with regard to the same phrase, “Goodbye”’s sequence goes from B-24 to C#-38 to B-36. On the other hand, “It’s So Hard to Say Goodbye to Yesterday”’s sequence is B-24, C#-26, G#-33.)

That being said, both songs apply to anyone who must leave someone behind. As Alicia is expressing throughout the song, it is unimaginably difficult (especially when it’s her first love).']])]

annotation:
[('I know why the caged bird sings', [['“I know why the caged bird sings” is a line from the poem, “Sympathy,” by Paul Laurence Dunbar, that was made famous as the title of Maya Angelou’s acclaimed 1969 autobiography. Angelou recounts her childhood struggles (among them, racism and rape) and how she overcame these hardships.

Keys and Angelou have since collaborated. In 2011, they performed together on the Oprah Winfrey Show.  In 2017, Keys recited Angelou’s “Still I Rise” at the Women’s March on Washington.']]), ('So she can fly, fly, fly
 Spreading her wings and her song
 Let her
 Fly, fly, fly
 For the whole world to see', [['She wants people to stop putting limits on her, so she can truly be herself and express that individuality through her songs. Alicia is no stranger to flying and being free. In “Girl On Fire”, she talks about flying away from the world’s problems.

She’s living in a world, and it’s on fire
Feeling the catastrophe, but she knows she can fly away.

She even has some songs with liberating titles, such as “How It Feels To Fly” and “The Element Of Freedom (Intro)”.']]), ('Mmm
 Right now, I feel like a bird
 Caged without a key
 Everyone comes to stare at me
 With so much joy and revelry
 They don’t know how I feel inside
 Through my smile, I cry
 They don’t know what they’re doing to me
 Keeping me from flying
 That’s why I say that', [['Key’s is expressing a feeling of being lost, with no where to go. Birds are meant to fly and be free, so one that is trapped in a cage with no key feels stuck. She feels like she has so much potential, but she is being held by back by the people who don’t understand her. Deep down she is hurting, but she masks it all with a simple smile.

She conveyed this same feeling of containment in an article years later. However, this time she compared herself to a lion trapped in a cage.

I felt like a lion locked in a cage. I felt like a girl misunderstood that no one really knew.

Even though she still felt trapped, the fact that she compared herself to a lion rather than a bird, showed growth and self empowerment.']])]

annotation:
[('And you always order the special, with the hot chocolate', [['If you review the video, the special is “Fried Fish w/ Yams and Greens”.

Who the hell orders fish with hot chocolate?']]), ('And when we had our first kiss
 It happened on a Thursday', [['The fact that she is noting a specific day of the week, when this is simply a fantasy, shows how much she really likes this guy. In the previous lines, she already set up the perfect date with him, and now, she’s moving on to the next step. Then the next!

She likely chose a specific day like this to make it seem more real. “It happened on a Thursday” sounds more auspicious than if she has just mentioned their first kiss somewhere down the line.']]), ('Hello? Can I speak to -- to Michael?', [['The hesitation in her question here says it all. She had to think about what his name was for a moment before she asked for him. We can gather from this phone conversation that there is a sort of “I barely know your name, and you don’t know mine” vibe between them. This adds to the mystery of her desire for him. They don’t know each other, but she still wants to know more about him.']]), ('You know, the one with the braids?', [['In the music video for this song, Alicia is seen with her hair in braids.



This line, along with many others in the song, compliments the title perfectly. The man she is calling “doesn’t know her name,” so she describes her hair to him, rather than just saying, “Hi, this is Alicia.”']]), ('Can you hear me now?', [['This song, released at the end of 2003, may be referencing the famous Verizon “Can you hear me now?” ads which began running in 2002.']]), ('This is the waitress from the coffee house on 39th and Lennox', [['This line caused quite the commotion online, so let’s set the record straight. There is NO coffee shop on 39th and Lenox (Ask A New Yorker).

However, there was a diner called Pan Pan on 135th Street and Lenox Avenue (also called Malcolm X Boulevard).



The restaurant has since been burned down, but in the music video for this song, we can see Alicia working here. She most likely misnamed the street to avoid a barrage of eager fans calling the restaurant and asking for information about her.

https://youtu.be/_ST6ZRbhGiA']]), ('Oh yeah, Thursday’s perfect, man”', [['This is a reference to an earlier line in the song, where she stated that in her fantasy, the first kiss between her and the one she admires “happened on a Thursday.” She is ecstatic now because she can feel her fantasy unfolding right before her eyes.']]), ('[Spoken Interlude]', [['At this point in the song, she starts to gain the confidence to finally stop just admiring him and actually do something about it. Most girls usually don’t have the courage to do this—as she mentions later in the phone call—but she finally manages to set up a date with him.']])]

annotation:
[('Lay your head on my pillow
 Here you can be yourself
 No one has to know what you are feeling
 No one but me and you, ooh', [['One someone is hiding a secret, or keeping their feelings to themselves, it can be physically exhausting, and take a toll on their body. She’s reassuring this person that with her, they can rest. It’s not important that others know how he feels, and what his thoughts are. She will keep everything he tells her confidential, like a dairy. The “pillow” could be one of two things.


A representation of a safe place to be, without worrying about what others think. Somewhere he can be himself and feel free.
Or, in a more literal sense, she could actually be offering him a place to rest his head, since keeping secrets to oneself can be so tiring.



“Lay your head on my pillow” is also a reference to Tony Toni Tone’s third single off of Sons Of Soul “(Lay Your Head on My) Pillow”.']]), ('Ooh baby, if there’s anything that you fear (Anything)
 Call 489-4608 and I’ll be here', [["This was actually Keys' old phone number in New York (at least when used with the proper 347 area code), and those who successfully called it could listen to a voice message from Keys herself. Of course, rabid fans tried plenty of other area codes and got in touch with people who had no idea about “Diary” or Keys herself."]])]

 And take a look at what’s goin’ on', [['Possible reference to Marvin Gaye’s “What’s Going On”']]), ('Well, now all I battle is your ego and your pride
 It’s ticking like a time bomb ready to ignite
 Hurtin’ me to fight', [['Another reference to Heru of whom it is said in the ancient Egyptian tablets that he will appear and set fire to the earth in 2012, that is the “time bomb”, but Alicia Keys has to test him before he is able to manifest, and it is sometimes difficult for her to do it because she knows who he is.']]), ('We would defend and protect one another (One another)
 Now I can’t tell if we’re enemies or lovers', [['In the background if you listen closely the melody says “Heru”, Heru is the ancient Egyptian God, so Alicia is talking to him wondering where their relationship together stands.']])]

annotation: [('My medulla oblongata will electrify', [['The medulla oblongata is the part of the brain that regulates breathing and the functioning of the heart, which is likely the reason why she used this specific medical term, rather than just referring to it as the brain. The way he makes her feel causes her heart to pound, and makes it hard for her to breathe.\n\nBy using the word “electrified,” this puts more emphasis on the intense feeling she gets when she’s with him. This word is usually used in a more sensual, passionate context, rather than just referring to a high school crush.']])]

annotation:
[('Hand me the world on a silver platter
 And what good would it be?
 With no one to share
 With no one who truly cares for me', [['To hand someone something on a silver platter means to give someone an extremely valuable possession for nothing in return.
She’s taking this phrase a step further to show how much this person means to her. If someone were to offer her the world on a silver platter, she still wouldn’t take it.



This says a lot about her uncaring attitude toward superficiality, and her strong desire to be with the one she loves instead. Even if she could have the world and all its riches, it would mean nothing if she didn’t have this person in her life.']]), ('Some people search for a fountain
 That promises forever young (Ya know)', [["‘The Fountain Of Youth' is a fictional thing which makes one young forever. People seem to desire to find a device that stops them losing their youth, when really they’re wasting it by trying to stop it.

Alicia doesn’t need to be young forever however. She doesn’t care how old she gets, as long as she grows old with him.

Even her friend Jay Z wants to be “Young Forever”!"]]), ('Some people want it all
 But I don’t want nothin’ at all
 If it ain’t you, baby
 If I ain’t got you, baby', [['In comparison to the rest of the world, Alicia isn’t asking for much.

She feels that love is all she needs and that all other materialistic aspects of life are surplus. Even the prospect of losing her love is impossibly painful to her.



On a technical note: The hook starts in a similar way to the chorus of “(You Make Me Feel Like A) Natural Woman” by Carole King. The two songs, in a way, are quite similar in meaning.']])]

annotation:
[('Lay your head on my pillow
 Here you can be yourself
 No one has to know what you are feeling
 No one but me and you, ooh', [['One someone is hiding a secret, or keeping their feelings to themselves, it can be physically exhausting, and take a toll on their body. She’s reassuring this person that with her, they can rest. It’s not important that others know how he feels, and what his thoughts are. She will keep everything he tells her confidential, like a dairy. The “pillow” could be one of two things.


A representation of a safe place to be, without worrying about what others think. Somewhere he can be himself and feel free.
Or, in a more literal sense, she could actually be offering him a place to rest his head, since keeping secrets to oneself can be so tiring.



“Lay your head on my pillow” is also a reference to Tony Toni Tone’s third single off of Sons Of Soul “(Lay Your Head on My) Pillow”.']]), ('Ooh baby, if there’s anything that you fear (Anything)
 Call 489-4608 and I’ll be here', [["This was actually Keys' old phone number in New York (at least when used with the proper 347 area code), and those who successfully called it could listen to a voice message from Keys herself. Of course, rabid fans tried plenty of other area codes and got in touch with people who had no idea about “Diary” or Keys herself."]])]

Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh
Ooh, ooh, ooh

('Round and 'round and 'round we go, will you ever know?)21Embed
annotation:
[('And you always order the special, with the hot chocolate', [['If you review the video, the special is “Fried Fish w/ Yams and Greens”.

Who the hell orders fish with hot chocolate?']]), ('And when we had our first kiss
 It happened on a Thursday', [['The fact that she is noting a specific day of the week, when this is simply a fantasy, shows how much she really likes this guy. In the previous lines, she already set up the perfect date with him, and now, she’s moving on to the next step. Then the next!

She likely chose a specific day like this to make it seem more real. “It happened on a Thursday” sounds more auspicious than if she has just mentioned their first kiss somewhere down the line.']]), ('Hello? Can I speak to -- to Michael?', [['The hesitation in her question here says it all. She had to think about what his name was for a moment before she asked for him. We can gather from this phone conversation that there is a sort of “I barely know your name, and you don’t know mine” vibe between them. This adds to the mystery of her desire for him. They don’t know each other, but she still wants to know more about him.']]), ('You know, the one with the braids?', [['In the music video for this song, Alicia is seen with her hair in braids.



This line, along with many others in the song, compliments the title perfectly. The man she is calling “doesn’t know her name,” so she describes her hair to him, rather than just saying, “Hi, this is Alicia.”']]), ('Can you hear me now?', [['This song, released at the end of 2003, may be referencing the famous Verizon “Can you hear me now?” ads which began running in 2002.']]), ('This is the waitress from the coffee house on 39th and Lennox', [['This line caused quite the commotion online, so let’s set the record straight. There is NO coffee shop on 39th and Lenox (Ask A New Yorker).

However, there was a diner called Pan Pan on 135th Street and Lenox Avenue (also called Malcolm X Boulevard).



The restaurant has since been burned down, but in the music video for this song, we can see Alicia working here. She most likely misnamed the street to avoid a barrage of eager fans calling the restaurant and asking for information about her.

https://youtu.be/_ST6ZRbhGiA']]), ('Oh yeah, Thursday’s perfect, man”', [['This is a reference to an earlier line in the song, where she stated that in her fantasy, the first kiss between her and the one she admires “happened on a Thursday.” She is ecstatic now because she can feel her fantasy unfolding right before her eyes.']]), ('[Spoken Interlude]', [['At this point in the song, she starts to gain the confidence to finally stop just admiring him and actually do something about it. Most girls usually don’t have the courage to do this—as she mentions later in the phone call—but she finally manages to set up a date with him.']])]

annotation:
[('When I’m breaking down and I can’t be found
 As I start to get weak
 ’Cause no one knows me underneath these clothes
 But I can fly
 We can fly, ohh', [['Even as a Superwoman, things aren’t always perfect. At the end of the day, we are still human, not superheroes, and things are bound to get wrong. But despite this, Keys states that we need to remember our true strong spirit and use this as fuel to rise up from the ashes and continue to strive and achieve greater heights.

This continues the superhero theme, as many superheroes function under aliases as normal people such as Superman himself who goes by Clark Kent on an everyday basis.



Nicki Minaj and Rihanna share this notion']]), ('’Cause I am a Superwoman
 Yes, I am (Yes, she is)
 Still when I’m a mess
 I still put on a vest
 With an “S” on my chest
 Oh, yes, I’m a Superwoman', [['Superwoman is a reference to several fictional characters from DC Comics with similar powers to Superman, such as Supergirl.



Alicia Keys gave Ebony Magazine her definition of a superwoman:

A superwoman is a woman who has incredible dreams, incredible ambitions, all the things she wants to do, but she also knows how to take care of herself.']])]

annotation:
[('So maybe we can go to first base
 Because I feel you
 Second base
 Want you to feel me too
 Third base
 Better pump the breaks
 Well baby, slow down
 I gotta go home now', [['The various bases are derived from Baseball bases and commonly used as metaphors for various stages in sexual activity.

First base entails mouth-to-mouth kissing, most commonly french kissing.

Second base entails skin-to-skin touching or touching through clothing above the waist and may also sometimes refer to manual stimulation and non-penetrative sex.

Third base refers to touching below the waist or oral stimulation. Essentially, everything but sexual intercourse.']]), ('It’s a matter of extreme importance
 My first teenage love affair', [['There’s a saying that goes: “your first love compared to your true love is like a flash of light compared to the sun”. Although she may not be with this boy forever, it’s still important to learn to experience love truly for the first time. Her first love affair may shape her ideas on love and relationships for years to come.

There may also be a slight sarcastic tone to these lines, as it’s simply a teenage love affair – it isn’t really extremely important as it will eventually fade and become a simple fond memory.']]), ('’Cause the lights are on outside
 Wish there was somewhere to hide', [['She prefers being with her lover in a private location. The lights may refer to literal lights but may also be referring to people. She doesn’t want other people to find out about their secret love affair.

This may also be a reference to kids who are usually told to return home from playtime outside when the streetlights come on. She doesn’t want to return to reality, and wishes to stay in the ethereal state of happiness with her lover. This further emphasizes the childlike innocence of their love.']])]

annotation:
[('Another tricky little gun giving', [['James Bond’s weapon of choice is the Walther PPK, known for its small size design which is easy to handle and conceal.

A “tricky little gun” in this case being the one thing that gives Bond solace.']]), ('Another ringer with the slick trigger finger for Her Majesty
 Another one with the golden tongue poisoning your fantasy', [['007 as portrayed by Daniel Craig could pretty much be set as the standard for a slick trigger finger “with the golden tongue poisoning your fantasy”, who is of course at the service of Her Majesty.



But Jack White gives us a nice double entendre here:

In australian slang, a “Ringer” can mean a phoney or an impostor, and at the same time it can mean an ‘expert’ of sorts. In this context meaning probably a double agent, or someone infiltrated in Bond’s organization, MI6.

So basically these first lines could very well be describing 007, or they could be describing just another way for him to die.']]), ('Yeah, a door left open, a woman walking by
 A drop in the water, a look in your eye
 A phone on the table, a man on your side
 Or someone that you think that you can trust
 It’s just another way to die', [['Besides from the obvious meaing of the chorus being written for a Bond movie, even the slightest thing left unattended can get you killed.

The main line here is:

Someone that you think that you can trust
It’s just another way to die

It may come as a direct reference to where the previous movie ended: Bond thinking he could trust Vesper, only to later find out she was the one that got him captured and almost killed.']]), ('Solace', [['Although the song doesn’t share a title with the Bond film in which it’s featured, the word “solace” is slipped into the lyrics.']])]

annotation:
[('Hell: The Sequel (2011)', [['Hell: The Sequel (2011)

Favourite song: “Living Proof”

What I like

I’m a big fan of the back and forth between Em and Royce. Two of the hardest hitting rappers in the game trading bar for bar. Em’s flow is still choppy, but I don’t hate it—to be honest I still don’t hate Em’s flow, but that’s beside the point. I wish there was more songs, because I enjoy all of them. My favourite is “Living Proof” because it’s the only song where I really feel Em got showed up. It’s not being ‘renegaded’ because it’s not an Em solo song, but he still lost; Royce brought it. Hopefully there’s more Bad Meets Evil coming!']]), ('90059 (2015)', [['90059 (2015)

Favourite song: “Vice City”

What I like

I wasn’t totally impressed with this album. It fell short in my books because it totally could’ve been so much better. I felt there was a lot of tracks that were a letdown, but at the same time it was solid album. Can’t really say much, but I enjoyed it!']]), ('The Documentary 2 (2015)', [['The Documentary 2 (2015)

Favourite song: “The Documentary 2”

What I like

Game really returned to form with this album. There’s so many bangers and good songs, but standouts include:


“On Me”
“Don’t Trip”
“Standing on Ferarris”



Really though, the only song I don’t like off this song is this one, which is just horrendous. Documentary 2 the song is just straight fire though:

Smoking la la like the Fugees
Thinking to myself, is it God or Lucy?
Prada or Gucci, popping Cris, Rihanna, Karrueche
Homie I ain’t gotta gas I’m so ahead of you fags
The shit I spit off Premo tracks burn confederate flags']]), ('DMX', [['I actually got all of DMX’s stuff after hearing the legendary story about the rap battle between him and Jay Z:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wTdDTYbc3Fc

Other than that, as of 2015, I haven’t listened to a single song of his other than the ones in movies. It’s on my list to listen to in 2016!']]), ('Diddy - Dirty Money', [['How many names/groups does this guy have']]), ('Demi Lovato', [['Growing up, Demi was surprisingly big in my life. Watching Disney Channel, it would be awesome when she’d pop up in a show. I also particularly remember “Camp Rock” with the Jonas Brothers. What a childhood. Anyways, Demi actually got pretty good with her 2015 release Confident.']]), ('Strange Clouds (2012)', [["Strange Clouds (2012)

Favourite song: “Strange Clouds”

What I like

This album just feels like it’s B.o.B.’s attempt at targeting every audience. “Strange Clouds” is meant to be played before a sporting event; that’s my fondest memory of this album. Before a hockey game, we’d play this song in the dressing room. To this day it’s still on my ‘pump up playlist’. “So Good” is a full 180 degree flip and is without a doubt B.o.B.’s attempt at following up the success of “Nothin' on You” and “Airplanes” and is a pretty epic fail. Still, I don’t actually hate this album and It’s ok… I wouldn’t play it everyday, scratch that; I wouldn’t play it every month, but it’s not a bad album."]]), ('B.o.B', [['B.o.B. is so hit and miss; he’s either really quite good or just borderline horrendous. His earlier stuff was pure pop (pretty much), but he started to get closer to rap with “Strange Clouds” and is now—from what I’ve heard—very experimental. I haven’t checked him out recently, but I’m a big fan of the experimental side of rap.

Just a quick side note: I’ve never understood the 3 stacks comparison. Can someone explain it to me?']]), ('AWOLNATION', [['Going through my music library, I didn’t even know I had these guys. I know “Sail” is awesome, but I had absolutely no idea that I was lucky enough to get their album. I’ll have to give them a listen :)']]), ('The Slumdon Bridge - EP (2011)', [['The Slumdon Bridge – EP (2011)

Favourite song: “You Don’t Know (For Fuck’s Sake)”

What I like

I was actually pretty bummed with this; it could’ve been pretty wicked. Only 4 songs, there’s still some solid songs on here. Ed Sheeran and Yelawolf seem like an unlikely combo, but they really could’ve got something really special going. Odds are, this is the only thing we’ll see from this duo.']])]

annotation:
[('And all of my friends think I’m crazy
 For loving you
 What they don’t know
 There’s nothing else I can do', [['Alicia’s husband, mega producer Swizz Beatz was previously married with children to Mashonda Tifrere in 2004. During the later part of their marriage they announced separation and he began to see Alicia in 2009. Later, he and his wife got divorced in 2010, then a pregnant Alicia and him were married the same year.

This song is essentially about the conflicts of being in love with a technically married man. Alicia’s friends think she’s insane for loving him, but she argues she simply cannot help it.']])]

annotation: [('Love is like the sea', [['This line could be a reference to the book “Their Eyes Were Watching God” by Zora Neale Hurston. At the end of the book the main character Janie is recounting her life story to her friend. She speaks about the loves and the losses she’s experienced along the way, and about how they’ve shaped her as a person.\n\nShe says that “[l]ove is like the sea. It’s a moving thing, but still and all, it takes its shape from the shore it meets, and its different with every shore.”']])]

annotation:
[('If I can touch the sky
 I’d risk the fall just to know how it feels to fly', [['She is well aware of both the positive and negative factors that come with risk taking, but she knows that some risks are worth it. She wants to be able to experience freedom even though there will be struggles along the way, or as she puts it, “the fall.”

These lines are reminiscent of some of her other songs in two ways:


“Caged Bird” and “Superwoman” both talk about self-empowerment and the feeling of flying.
“The Element Of Freedom” and “28 Thousand Days” touch on carpe diem, the reasons for flying and being free, rather than the action of doing so.



The lines in this song are a perfect combination of the lyrics to those songs. She wraps up everything she discussed in those songs into one nice lyric here.']])]

annotation:
[('Hand me the world on a silver platter
 And what good would it be?
 With no one to share
 With no one who truly cares for me', [['To hand someone something on a silver platter means to give someone an extremely valuable possession for nothing in return.
She’s taking this phrase a step further to show how much this person means to her. If someone were to offer her the world on a silver platter, she still wouldn’t take it.



This says a lot about her uncaring attitude toward superficiality, and her strong desire to be with the one she loves instead. Even if she could have the world and all its riches, it would mean nothing if she didn’t have this person in her life.']]), ('Some people search for a fountain
 That promises forever young (Ya know)', [["‘The Fountain Of Youth' is a fictional thing which makes one young forever. People seem to desire to find a device that stops them losing their youth, when really they’re wasting it by trying to stop it.

Alicia doesn’t need to be young forever however. She doesn’t care how old she gets, as long as she grows old with him.

Even her friend Jay Z wants to be “Young Forever”!"]]), ('Some people want it all
 But I don’t want nothin’ at all
 If it ain’t you, baby
 If I ain’t got you, baby', [['In comparison to the rest of the world, Alicia isn’t asking for much.

She feels that love is all she needs and that all other materialistic aspects of life are surplus. Even the prospect of losing her love is impossibly painful to her.



On a technical note: The hook starts in a similar way to the chorus of “(You Make Me Feel Like A) Natural Woman” by Carole King. The two songs, in a way, are quite similar in meaning.']])]

title: Karma
lyrics:

What you doin' to me?
You're confusing me
Don't play with me

What goes up must come down
Now who's crying, desiring to come back to me
What goes around comes around
What goes up must come down
Gotta stop tryin' to come back to me

What goes around comes around

annotation:
[('I keep on fallin’ in and out
 Of love with you
 I never loved someone
 The way that I’m lovin’ you', [["Alicia Keys talked particularly about this hook herself in a Billboard interview in 2001:

[… “Fallin'”] is about the ins and outs of a relationship. Sometimes, you’re completely head-over-heels in love with someone, and sometimes you can’t stand that person. You fall in and out, sometimes it goes back and forth, and that’s just what relationships are about."]])]

title: Brand New Me
lyrics:
Brand New Me Lyrics[Verse 1]
It’s been awhile, I’m not who I was before
You look surprised, your words don’t burn me anymore
Been meaning to tell you, but I guess it’s clear to see
Don’t be mad, it’s just a brand new kind of me
Can't be bad, I found a brand new kind of free

[Verse 2]
Careful with your ego, he’s the one that we should blame
Had to grab my heart back, God knew something had to change
I thought that you’d be happy
I found the one thing I need
Why you mad? It’s just the brand new kind of me
[Chorus]
It took a long, long time to get here
It took a brave, brave girl to try
It took one too many excuses, one too many lies
Don't be surprised, don't be surprised

[Verse 3]
If I talk a little louder, if I speak up when you're wrong
If I walk a little taller, I been under you too long
If you notice that I'm different, don't take it personally
Don't be mad, it's just a brand new kind of me
And it ain't bad, I found a brand new kind of free

[Chorus]
It took a long, long road to get here
It took a brave, brave girl to try
I've taken one too many excuses, one too many lies
Don't be surprised, see you look surprised
[Bridge]
If you were a friend, you wanna get to know me again
If your were worth a while, you'd be happy to see me smile
I'm not expecting sorry, I'm too busy finding myself
I've got this, I've found me, I've found me

[Verse 4]
I don’t need your opinion, I’m not waiting for your okay
I’ll never be perfect, but at least now I’m brave
Now my heart is open, and I can finally breathe
Don’t be mad, it’s just a brand new kind of free
That ain't bad, I found a brand new kind of me
Don't be mad, it's just a brand new time for meYou might also like9Embed
annotation:
[('It took a long, long road to get here
 It took a brave, brave girl to try
 I’ve taken one too many excuses, one too many lies
 Don’t be surprised, see you look surprised', [["She’s talking about her journey through life, and her growth into becoming a better person. In a later interview with Rolling Stone, when asked about what advice she would give her younger self, she replied:

In a way, I’m like, “Man, what a frickin' awesome person I am now,” and I know that that is because of all the things I experienced, so I wouldn’t want to have done anything different.

That has a strong connection to what she is saying here. The “long, long road” symbolizes all the things she has experienced. She goes on to call herself brave, and tells the people that knew her as she was before, not to be surprised that she is a new person now. By using the word “girl” instead of woman, she evokes a sense of naivety and lostness, like she has portrayed in “Nobody Not Really (Interlude)”, “Troubles”, and “Caged Bird”, which were all songs from her previous albums. But now, instead of just a girl, she’s a girl on fire."]]), ('It took a long, long time to get here
 It took a brave, brave girl to try
 It took one too many excuses, one too many lies
 Don’t be surprised, don’t be surprised', [["Keys is talking about her journey through life, and her growth into becoming a better person. In a later interview with Rolling Stone, when asked about what advice she would give her younger self, she replied:

In a way, I’m like, “Man, what a frickin' awesome person I am now,” and I know that that is because of all the things I experienced, so I wouldn’t want to have done anything different.

The quote has strong connection to what she is saying here. The “long, long road” symbolizes all the things she has experienced. She goes on to call herself brave, and tells the people that knew her as she was before, not to be surprised that she is a new person now. By using the word “girl” instead of woman, she evokes a sense of naivety and lostness, like she has portrayed in “Nobody Not Really (Interlude)”, “Troubles”, and “Caged Bird”, which were all songs from her previous albums. But now, instead of just a girl, she’s a girl on fire."]]), ('If I talk a little louder, if I speak up when you’re wrong
 If I walk a little taller, I been under you too long
 If you notice that I’m different, don’t take it personally', [['Back in the first verse, Alicia Keys tells her friend that her development was self-evident:

Been meaning to tell you, but I guess it’s clear to see

This is the evidence she was referring to. She has grown mentally and physically. Her posture and voice correlate to how her feelings.

Walking taller, with her shoulders up and head up high, is a sign of self-pride: it proves that she thinks highly of herself, and she will not let other put her down physically or emotionally.

Speaking louder and with less hesitation proves shows that she knows what’s on her mind and that she will speak her mind no matter what.

Ultimately, Alicia’s presentation tells us that she is woman who stands her ground.']]), ('[Bridge]', [['This is Alicia’s favorite part of the song:

My favorite part of that song is the bridge. […] All of us have had [this] type of realization: ‘You don’t control me. You might have at one time, but you don’t anymore.’ I love that song so much. It’s so freaking real.



  


(Source: Complex magazine, “Alicia Keys: Unlocking Alicia (2012 Cover Story)”, November 13, 2012']]), ('I don’t need your opinion, I’m not waiting for your okay
 I’ll never be perfect, but at least now I’m brave', [['These lines are basically a conclusion to the song. Although she will never truly be what the world views as “perfect,” she knows she is good enough, and has the courage to stay that way. She is proud of who she is.

‘Brand New Me’ is about the journey it takes to get to a place where you are proud to be a new you.']])]

annotation: [('Spirit of Marilyn callin’ me, audibly', [['She feels so overwhelmed due to all the hate, trials & tribulations within her life that she’s starting to self destruct & that voice in her head telling her to end it all is becoming more an more audible. Presumable the same voice that pushed Marilyn & many others who have been in similar situations (as far as fame goes).\n\nAlso… this is probably a callback to her song, “Marilyn Monroe” from her album, Roman Reloaded.']]), ('’cause I win the gold like Gabby', [['Gabby Douglas won gold at the 2012 Olympics in gymnastics.']])]

To the ways I could love you, babe
Take me over, I can't get over
There's no limits, no no
To the ways I could love you, babe

[Post-Chorus]
One two three, to infinity, yeah
Two three four, it's ubiquity
It's four five six, to a limitedless love

[Verse 2]
If there's another one
He's not in this world, love
Can't be no other one
There is only you
Oh, and one and one, only leads us to love
And when I'm through being your girl
We can stop the whole world for us

[Bridge]
I'm saying, whoa
Feel it up and down and in your soul
I'll forever be here at his mercy, mercy, mercy
Loving him for eternity, eternity, eternity
'Cause I...
You might also like[Chorus]
I can't count to no amount
There's no limits, no no
To the ways I could love you, babe
Take me over, I can't get over
There's no limits, no no
To the ways I could love you, babe

[Post-Chorus]
One two three, to infinity, yeah
Two three four, it's ubiquity
It's four five six, to a limitedless love

[Bridge]
Ah oh oh, oh oh oh
Ah oh oh, oh oh oh

[Pre-Chorus]
One two three, to infinity yeah
Two three four, this is my decree yeah
Four five six, to a limitedless love

[Outro]
A limited, limited, limited, limitedless love
A limitedless love, a limitedless love
A limited, limited, limited, limitedless love
A limitedless love, a limitedless love
Ah oh oh, oh oh oh
Ah oh oh, oh oh ohEmbed
annotation:
[('I took the red pill', [['In the 1999 film “The Matrix”:

Blue Pill – Wake up and make your own assumptions about what has happened

Red Pill – See how deep the rabbit hole is

In this case, Alicia is saying she wants to see how far this love affair will go, which we obviously know is “Limitedless”']]), ('Bloody murder', [['Popular term frequently used in “dancehall”; meaning to scream at the top of your lungs. In this case, Alicia is starting the song off to let you know that she is insanely in love and she wants everyone to know']])]

title: One Thing
lyrics:
One Thing Lyrics[Intro]
What, where am I?

[Verse 1]
What's life like on a train?
Nobody there knows your name
As your decision changed
Do you wish that I came?
I thought you'd pick me up from work
I waited for your truck for half hour
I know you said you were gonna
But I never thought you'd leave
[Chorus]
This one thing that was made for us
Chasing us, saving us
I take one thing over everything
I take that thing over anybody, oh

[Verse 2]
Square face and puppy eyes
Found out they never lied
Your old man lived in the sky
Left your house with a yard
But you went away a different try
Found a place that's your size
Too good to finish life here with me
I couldn't get you to say
Why you wouldn't let me come
What should be simple just ain't
And it shouldn't hurt like it does

[Chorus]
This one thing is made for us
Won't stay with us, it ain't saving us
But I'll take one thing over everything
I'll take that thing over anybody

[Bridge]
Baby, hold me, don't pick me up
I need a compliment
Just a touch from a friend
I need a gentle word
I need your company
I'll keep
You might also like[Chorus]
One thing that was made for us
Chasing us, saving us
I take one thing over anything
I take that thing over anybody
I take one thing over everything
I take that thing over anybody
Oh, oh, anything
Oh, oh, take one thing3Embed

101 Lyrics[Verse 1]
You used to the sound of a heart that's breaking
I know it don't faze you anymore
You're the king of the game that you're playing
I know you've played it a hundred times before
You fill your bedroom up with trophies
Then you get a kick out of closing the door
Got all the words to keep on hoping
I know you've said them a hundred times before

[Chorus]
Then there's me, all fox for your gun
Then there's me, just love me for fun
Then there's me, no use in pretending
Oh there's me, 101
[Verse 2]
I might as well stand in front of a bullet
Close my eyes and kick the chair to the floor
It's like a speeding train is coming
I know you've crashed it 100 times before

[Chorus]
Then there's me, all fox for your gun
Then there's me, just love me for fun
Then there's me, no use in pretending
Oh there's me, 101

[Bridge]
Everybody says I gotta be crazy
That I deserve everything that I get
But I got a feeling
That makes me wanna ignore all that you've done a 100 times before

[Chorus 2]
'Cause then there's me, could I be the one?
And baby, there's me, to make you undone
Uh darling there's me, no use, no use in pretending
Oh there's me, 101
Me, 101

[Outro]
So I gotta be, I gotta be, I gotta be a 101
Maybe it's time, maybe it's me
Maybe I could be, maybe pretend
I gotta be, I wanna be 101
Yeah, babyYou might also like5Embed
annotation:
[('Close my eyes and kick the chair to the floor', [['Another reference to death, as when someone commits suicide by hanging. They must kick the chair to finalize the act. She might as well give up on the situation…']]), ('Then there’s me, no use in pretending', [['She emphasizes her vulnerabilty. There is no need to appear strong or better than the situation “ No use in pretending. She says ” right there" that is me… another one.

Also, she could be witnessing another woman with the same man! and she sees her self.']]), ('Then there’s me, all fox for your gun', [['Foxes very rarely escape gun shootings unless they are fantastic to a certain extent.



Alicia uses this to describe that women can very rarely escape this man’s gun and she cannot help but be in love with him.']])]

title: Girl On Fire
lyrics:
Girl On Fire Lyrics[Verse 1]
She's just a girl and she's on fire
Hotter than a fantasy
Lonely like a highway
She's livin' in a world and it's on fire
Filled with catastrophe
But she knows she can fly away

[Pre-Chorus]
Oh, oh-oh-oh-oh
She got both feet on the ground
And she's burnin' it down
Oh-oh-oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh-oh
She got her head in the clouds
And she's not backin' down
[Chorus]
This girl is on fire
This girl is on fire
She's walkin' on fire
This girl is on fire

[Verse 2]
Looks like a girl, but she's a flame
So bright, she can burn your eyes
Better look the other way
You can try, but you'll never forget her name
She's on top of the world
Hottest of the hottest girls, say

[Pre-Chorus]
Oh, oh-oh-oh-oh
We got our feet on the ground
And we're burnin' it down
Oh-oh-oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh-oh
Got our head in the clouds
And we're not comin' down

[Chorus]
This girl is on fire (Fire, fire)
This girl is on fire
She's walkin' on fire (Fire, fire)
This girl is on fire
You might also like[Bridge]
(Oh-oh-oh-oh-oh)
Everybody stares as she goes by
'Cause they can see the flame that's in her eyes
Watch her when she's lightin' up the night
Nobody knows that she's a lonely girl
And it's a lonely world
But she gon' let it burn, baby, burn, baby

[Chorus]
This girl is on fire (Fire, fire)
This girl is on fire
She's walkin' on fire (Fire, fire)
This girl is on fire

[Drop]
Oh-oh-oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh-oh
Oh-oh-oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh
Oh-oh-oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh-oh
Oh-oh-oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh
Oh-oh-oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh-oh
Oh-oh-oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh
Oh-oh-oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh-oh
Oh-oh-oh-oh, oh

[Outro]
She's just a girl, but she's on fire52Embed
annotation:
[('This girl is on fire
 This girl is on fire', [['that isnt very safe']]), ('She’s livin’ in a world and it’s on fire
 Filled with catastrophe
 But she knows she can fly away', [['She admits that the world is falling apart, and by calling it a catastrophe, this really sheds light on how she feels about it. She has expressed this same view in “We Are Here,” where she lists the myriad of problems people today have to face. However, despite the desperate condition of the world, she knows she can escape it and fly, fly, fly away from the present difficulties.']])]

title: Another Way to Die
lyrics:
Another Way to Die Lyrics[Verse 1: Jack White & Alicia Keys]
Another ringer with the slick trigger finger for Her Majesty
Another one with the golden tongue poisoning your fantasy
Another bill from a killer, turned a thriller to a tragedy

[Chorus: Jack White & Alicia Keys]
Yeah, a door left open, a woman walking by
A drop in the water, a look in your eye
A phone on the table, a man on your side
Or someone that you think that you can trust
It's just another way to die
[Verse 2: Jack White & Alicia Keys]
Another tricky little gun giving solace to the one
That'll never see the sun shine
Another inch of your life sacrificed for your brother, in the nick of time
Another dirty money, heaven sent honey, turning on a dime

[Chorus: Jack White & Alicia Keys]
Well, a door left open, a woman walking by
A drop in the water, a look in your eye
A phone on the table, a man on your side
Or someone that you think that you can trust
It's just another way to die

[Bridge: Jack White & Alicia Keys]
It's just another
Hey!
It's just another
You're nothing to me, die
It's just another
Shoot 'em, bang, bang!

[Verse 3: Jack White & Alicia Keys, Both]
Another girl with her finger on the world
Singing to you what you wanna hear
Another gun thrown down in surrender took away your fear, hey
Another man there, he stands right behind you looking in the mirror
You might also like[Chorus: Jack White & Alicia Keys]
A door left open, a woman walking by
A drop in the water, a look in the eye
A phone on the table, a man on your side
Or someone that you think that you can trust
It's just another way to die

[Outro: Jack White & Alicia Keys]
It's just another
It's just another
It's just another way!
Shoot 'em up, bang, bang
Hey! Hey!
It's just another
Yeah! Yeah!
It's just another
It's just another
It's just another
It's just another day!
Bang, bang, bang, bang5Embed
annotation:
[('Another tricky little gun giving', [['James Bond’s weapon of choice is the Walther PPK, known for its small size design which is easy to handle and conceal.

A “tricky little gun” in this case being the one thing that gives Bond solace.']]), ('Another ringer with the slick trigger finger for Her Majesty
 Another one with the golden tongue poisoning your fantasy', [['007 as portrayed by Daniel Craig could pretty much be set as the standard for a slick trigger finger “with the golden tongue poisoning your fantasy”, who is of course at the service of Her Majesty.



But Jack White gives us a nice double entendre here:

In australian slang, a “Ringer” can mean a phoney or an impostor, and at the same time it can mean an ‘expert’ of sorts. In this context meaning probably a double agent, or someone infiltrated in Bond’s organization, MI6.

So basically these first lines could very well be describing 007, or they could be describing just another way for him to die.']]), ('Yeah, a door left open, a woman walking by
 A drop in the water, a look in your eye
 A phone on the table, a man on your side
 Or someone that you think that you can trust
 It’s just another way to die', [['Besides from the obvious meaing of the chorus being written for a Bond movie, even the slightest thing left unattended can get you killed.

The main line here is:

Someone that you think that you can trust
It’s just another way to die

It may come as a direct reference to where the previous movie ended: Bond thinking he could trust Vesper, only to later find out she was the one that got him captured and almost killed.']]), ('Solace', [['Although the song doesn’t share a title with the Bond film in which it’s featured, the word “solace” is slipped into the lyrics.']])]

title: Empire State Of Mind [Jay-Z + Alicia Keys]
lyrics:
Hot Rap Songs Chart 25th Anniversary: Top 100 Songs LyricsTo honor the 25th anniversary of Billboard's Hot Rap Songs chart, we’re counting down the tally's top 100 tracks ever

Rap is a victorious genre. Having built its history on songs of overcoming the harshest of hard-knock lives, in addition to observances of all of life's nuances, rap is more than just dope beats and rhymes. Its lyrics tell stories with insights and uncommon honesty, traits that have ultimately taken the genre from niched inner-city beginnings to a longstanding place at the heart of pop culture

So it was fitting for Billboard to create a chart, in 1989, dedicated to the then-rising genre, birthed out of hip-hop. At the time, MTV's influential "Yo! MTV Raps" was only a few months old, and acts like Ice-T and N.W.A were not only ruling rap but beginning to enter the mainstream music conversation

While rap has evolved, there’s no denying its ever-growing power. To celebrate the 25th anniversary of the Billboard’s Hot Rap Songs chart, we’re counting down the top 100 songs in the tally’s quarter-century history. From Salt-N-Pepa to Macklemore, we've got the genre's past quarter-century covered

annotation: [('Ice-T and N.W.A were not only ruling rap but beginning to enter the mainstream music conversation', [['Ice-T and N.W.A surely were two of the biggest names in the game. Both artists hold a tremendous amount of influence until the present day, not mentioning their contributions to gangsta rap.\n\nBut it’s also important to note that other legendary groups were active and well at that year. You have BDP, who already suffered the heavy loss of Scott La Rock, Gang Starr, who had both extremely talented artists MC Guru and DJ Premier, and De La Soul, who was dropping 3 Feet High & Rising, defended by some as the most influential album of all time.']])]

title: Fireworks
lyrics:
Fireworks Lyrics[Verse 1: Drake]
Money just changed everything
I wonder how life without it would go
From the concrete who knew that a flower would grow
Looking down from the top and it's crowded below
My fifteen minutes started an hour ago
Truth over fame, you know I respect the blatant shit
When I hear 'em talking, I just don't know what to make of it
Hate is so familiar to me, I'm slowly embracing it
Doesn't come natural, bear with me, it could take a bit
Yeah, and my dreams are who I'm racing with
But you can see I'm pacing it so that I'm always chasing it
Wayne put me right here, that's who I get the paper with
I hope that my success never alters our relationship
Yeah, this life is something I would die for
October's Own but it's looking like July 4
I just wish they'd let you try it first
This time I'm really going off, fireworks

Oh, today it begins
I've missed them before
But won't miss them again

Taking off like—Oh

I'm just such a gentleman, you should give it up for me
Look at how I'm placing all my napkins and my cutlery
I could tell it wasn't love, I just thought you'd fuck with me
Who could've predicted Lucky Strike would have you stuck with me
Damn, I kept my wits about me luckily
What happened between us that night?
It always seems to trouble me
Now all of a sudden, these gossip rags want to cover me
And you making it seem like it happened that way because of me
But I was curious
And I'll never forget it, baby, what an experience
You could've been the one but it wasn't that serious
There was smoke in the air before, that was me clearing it
That felt good, all in all, I learned a lesson from it though
You never see it coming, you just get to see it go
Yeah, I should've looked up in the sky at first
Now I can see it in her eyes, fireworks
You might also like[Pre-Chorus: Drake]
Oh, today it begins
I've missed them before
But won't miss them again
I keep having the same dream
And I think that I just realized what it means

[Chorus: Alicia Keys]
All I see is fireworks
All I see is fireworks
Every night it's fireworks
Every night it's fireworks
All I see is fireworks
All I see is fireworks
Taking off like fireworks
Taking off like—Oh

[Verse 3: Drake]
Everythin' the same but it feels different
My dad called me up knowing that I still listen
And he's still got his foot out, guilt tripping
It's been years though, I just learn to deal with it
For real, me and my realtor, we built up a better rapport
Got my mother in a place with some better decor
She searched the entire city, I let her explore
And now she's saying she more lonely than ever before
How many of our parents marriages lasted?
I was only 5, I bet I barely reacted
I'm flying back home for the Heritage Classic
Searching for that feeling, tell me where is the magic
Let's stay together 'til we're ghosts
I want to witness love, I never seen it close
Yeah, but I guess I gotta find it first
That's why I'm really going off, fireworks
[Pre-Chorus: Drake]
Oh, today it begins
I've missed them before
But won't miss them again
I keep having the same dream
And I think that I just realized what it means

[Chorus: Alicia Keys]
All I see is fireworks
All I see is fireworks
Every night it's fireworks
Every night it's fireworks
All I see is fireworks
All I see is fireworks
Taking off like fireworks
Taking off like—Oh31Embed
annotation:
[('Yeah, but I guess I gotta find it first', [['This is most likely a reference to Drake’s hit single “Find Your Love” which revolves around the topic of Drake wanting to find the love that the right woman for him has.

Also connects with the last line “I want to witness love, I never seen it close”']]), ('I’ve missed them before
 But won’t miss them again', [['Drake is saying here that he had some chances during his childhood to become more successful in his life but couldn’t take advantage of them because of all of his recent struggles. However, because of where he is now and how he made a big name for himself, he won’t miss those opportunities again']]), ('And he’s still got his foot out, guilt tripping', [['Drake’s father at this time was still blaming Drake for everything that happened between him and his Mom and for the things Drake said about him in some of his songs. “Guilt tripping” essentially means to make someone feel guilty']]), ('My fifteen minutes started an hour ago', [['Consider the idea of “fifteen minutes of fame” which suggests an artist lacking longevity, unable to withstand the course of a full career.

Drake is saying that this “fifteen minutes of fame” sentiment doesn’t apply to him. Refer to his sustained time in the spotlight as a well-known television star prior to this rap debut.

Stopping critics before they start, Drake’s preemptively muting those willing to assume this debut album is representative of his first foray into the spotlight or otherwise minute one of his fifteen minutes of fame—it isn’t.

An hour being sixty minutes, is multiple times longer than fifteen minutes, this suggests Drake’s confidence in his own ability to continue to thrive.']]), ('Money just changed everything', [['This line serves as the transition from “So Far Gone” to “Thank Me Later”. Drake mentioned in an interview with MTV that “the last line of the third verse in the song "Fear” is gonna be the first line on my album [Thank Me Later]“. The last line of that track is: "It’s funny how money can change everything”.']]), ('I keep having the same dream
 And I think that I just realized what it means', [['Drake explains this dream in an interview with Billboard:

“I kept having this reoccurring dream that I was standing in this field by where my uncle used to play golf and coincidentally, where my uncle played golf and where my grandfather is buried are right beside each other. I kept having this dream that I was standing in the middle of that field and watching these fireworks go off. For a really long time I was trying to figure out what it all meant, and I guess the conclusion that I came to was, I’m at a very triumphant point in my life. I think I can make a lot of things happen for not only myself but a lot of people around me.”']]), ('Yeah, I should’ve looked up in the sky at first
 Now I can see it in her eyes, fireworks', [['Going toward the point of walking blindly, Drake believes before things went downhill, he should have “looked up” for answers first. Now when he looks in his girl’s eyes, he can see the buildup of “fireworks” or strong emotions (whether rage &/or happiness)']]), ('All I see is fireworks
 All I see is fireworks
 Every night it’s fireworks
 Every night it’s fireworks
 All I see is fireworks
 All I see is fireworks
 Taking off like fireworks
 Taking off like—Oh', [['Drake interprets fireworks to be a symbol of rapid success. Seeing as this song came after Drake dropped a string of successful mixtapes, EPs, and singles, it really must have felt like he was surrounded by fireworks.']]), ('I just wish they’d let you try it first
 This time I’m really going off, fireworks', [['Drake wishes that he could “test out” fame before becoming a superstar so that you could adapt yourself to this new lifestyle without being consumed by it.

Drake is using fireworks as a metaphor for his seemingly explosive rise to fame, as he essentially became an overnight celebrity after the release of his So Far Gone mixtape, led by lead single “Best I Ever Had”.']]), ('Wayne put me right here, that’s who I get the paper with
 I hope that my success never alters our relationship', [['Drake’s career really took off when he was co-signed by Lil Wayne and signed to Wayne’s Young Money Entertainment label. While things are good between them now, Drake knows that success can drive even the greatest of groups apart.

Drake said in an interview that this verse addresses:

…the sort of fear that me and Wayne will be driven apart by the fact that I actively did gain success as an artist, and I always worry that sometimes that might drive a wedge between us, which I pray it never will and which I say in the song.']])]

[… “Fallin'”] is about the ins and outs of a relationship. Sometimes, you’re completely head-over-heels in love with someone, and sometimes you can’t stand that person. You fall in and out, sometimes it goes back and forth, and that’s just what relationships are about."]])]

[('We’ll be a real team
 We’ll be a real team', [['By making efforts together, they can achieve the relationship they want']]), ('We’re growing cold
 It’s getting old', [['Whatever relations they still have with each other are coming to an end, and have been for a while']]), ('Playing all these games and
 I wonder who’s to blame it
 I sit and think it’s you, I’m sure the feelings mutual', [['The singer’s been losing control since his ex left, and he thinks that they’re the reason why, while his ex probably thinks that he’s the reason why instead']]), ('And so are you
 I think it’s something positive, and negative too', [['The singer’s ex has also been putting effort into their life, and he recognises how much they’ve improved as a person; but this also creates issues because he misses them and is having to see them flourish without him']]), ('Would you like to work with me, I’d love to work you', [['The singer is inviting the other person to work with him so they can be together, and despite the fact that he thinks he’s a challenge to be with (‘work you’) he is willing to put effort in']]), ('There’s work to do', [['If they were to ever get back together – which the singer wants – then they’d have to work hard to achieve the life they want with eachother']]), ('These days are great', [['The singer’s been working and his life has changed greatly since the two of them were with eachother']]), ('I’m seeing all you gave and
 It somehow don’t seem even close to what I’d do
 To break in two seems natural', [['He’s been thinking about all the person did for their relationship, and how it’s so different to both what he did and what he’d do now, and so their breakup was justified']]), ('I sit and think of you, I hope the feeling’s mutual', [['The singer has been thinking about somebody he was once involved with, and hopes that the person is doing the same about him']])]

If no one is watching, does what he did, or who she was, even matter beyond what it means for the two of them?']])]

title: Movies
lyrics:
Movies Lyrics[Verse 1]
At slow speed we all seem focused
In motion we seem wrong, wrong
In summer we can taste the rain

[Chorus]
I want you to be free
Don't worry about me
And just like the movies
We play out our last scene
[Verse 2]
Two can play this game
We both want power
In winter we can taste the pain
In our short years, we come long way
To treat it bad and throw away
In our short years, we come long way
To treat it bad and throw away

[Chorus]
I want you to be free
Don't worry about me
And just like the movies
We play out our last scene
You won't cry, I won't scream

[Bridge]
In our short years, we come long way
To treat it bad and throw away
And if we make a little space
A science-fiction showcase
In our short film, a love disgrace
Dream a scene to brighten face
In our short years we come long way
To treat it bad, just to throw it away
You might also like[Chorus]
I want you to be free
Don't worry about me
And just like the movies
We play out our last scene
You won't cry, I won't scream4Embed
annotation:
[('In our short film, a love disgrace
 Dream a scene to brighten face', [['The relationship was quite brief, and perhaps did not end as well as it could have. Regardless, humans have the ability to remember selectively or embellish, thus “dream[ing] a scene to brighten face”.']]), ('You won’t cry, I won’t scream', [['Trying to avoid a tearful separation, the speaker proscribes that the other person break down into tears, and equally that the speaker scream in frustration or horror. One can imagine two people barely holding on to their emotions, being pried from one another by fate.']]), ('In our short years, we come long way
 To treat it bad and throw away
 In our short years, we come long way
 To treat it bad and throw away', [['Though the relationship, and maybe even the participants, has not had a particularly long life, the speaker muses the tragedy that it would end in mutual acrimony. If the two were aware that they would be separated, it is possible the two subconsciously sabotaged their relationships as a way of “turning into the skid”, or coming to separate on bad terms so that the separation is not tearful, but rather seen as a relief.']]), ('In winter we can taste the pain', [['Winter, in contrast to summer, is often used to indicate a period of decay or desolation. As this stanza proves a starker, more pessimistic variant of the first, it is interesting that the speaker goes from “tast[ing] the rain” to “tast[ing] the pain”. The former is a clear sensory experience, though it may have poetic connotations. Pain cannot literally be tasted, and so the latter sentence can only be taken figuratively. This may be referencing how often relationships delve into abstract mind games wherein every utterance by the other person is disassembled and meticulously deconstructed for potential ulterior meanings. This, invariably, leads to a great deal of pain, indeed!']]), ('We both want power', [['Power, in the sense of a relationship, is often exercised through taking advantage of the emotional effect one has on the other person. Relationships, therefore, can often become a contest of stoicism, stymieing communication and suffocating the partnership.']]), ('Two can play this game', [['No relationship is ever perfect, and strange “games” can be played out between two people out of mutual insecurities.']]), ('And just like the movies
 We play out our last scene', [['A poignant line, artfully expressing how we tend to construct our past as an audiovisual narrative similar to vignettes of a film. Anyone who has interacted with another person knowing this will be the last time they see them could attest to the surreality of such encounters perfectly described by the speaker as two people “play[ing] out [their] last scene” in a film.']]), ('Don’t worry about me', [['“Don’t worry” does not mean “stop caring”, and usually is not something you say to an indifferent or hostile person. The separation is amicable, probably caused by life circumstances beyond either party’s control. The speaker is going to go on to live their life, and does not want the other person to feel they are causing them undue pain.']]), ('I want you to be free', [['The speaker is making reference to a soon-to-be or past separation, possibly the breakup of a summer romance. Despite the mirth the speaker has shared with the person addressed, they do not desire to tie anyone down on the basis of a joyous past.']]), ('In summer we can taste the rain', [['Summer is commonly used as a motif in media to indicate a time of prosperity or general happiness. During a time of joy and ease, even an unfortunate circumstance, such as the rain, can be borne more easily, and even enjoyed. The further reference to the sense of taste indicates that, when one experiences life, cold analysis and facts do not come into play nearly as much as pure senses and feelings.']])]

annotation:
[('And it’s so hard to get out of bed (x3)
 She’s impossible to get out of your head', [['Dryden is finding it hard to function because he’s too busy thinking about her']]), ('Now you kindly kiss up to her
 But the feeling’s dead', [['Despite the person confessing all the wrongs they’ve done, the moment has passed, and nothing they do will ever redeem them in the girl’s eyes']]), ('Tried to give you summer, but I’m winter
 Wish I could make you spring, but I fall so hard', [['The singer is saying that even though he really wants to be the man that she really wants, and to give her everything she desires from a relationship, he isn’t the right person for it and thus isn’t capable of doing so. ‘But I fall so hard’ is him saying that even though he can’t do these things, he really is in love with her.']])]

annotation: [('All this time, we heard alarms', [['The “alarms” they heard were supposed to prevent them from seeing each other again, yet they didn’t stop doing so.']]), ('Your solitude is welcome, welcome', [['Dryden is saying that because he treated his girl so badly, he completely understands why she needs some time to herself, and that he won’t think any less of her.']]), ('All you see is red lights behind me', [['The top light of traffic lights, which means “stop,” is generally red. Seeing red lights behind someone would tell you to stop doing whatever you’re doing with them, and with the lights behind the speaker, it suggests he’s mostly unaware of these “stop signals” his lover sees.']]), ('Maybe I’ll spend my off-time without you', [['When he is away from work or chores, he doesn’t spend that time with his lady, as their relationship is not going as well as he planned.']]), ('Maybe I act on confused behavior', [['Maybe the singer is trying to be a good partner, but doesn’t necessarily know how.']])]

annotation: [('You moan a tone so low beyond me\n A telepathic sub-sonic frequency', [['“Subsonic,” or slower than the speed of sound, is often used to mean “infrasonic,” or below the range of human hearing. Pairing this with “telepathic” suggests that whatever communication the the subject of the song is giving the speaker, he is not receiving it, whether because he can’t detect it or becuase they’re not actually communicating their expectations at all.']]), ('I never meant to do wrong to you\n You’re my starfish', [['Starfish can re-grow severed limbs. This may indicate that the speaker was hard on the subject of the song because he felt they could take it.']])]

title: Glow
lyrics:
Glow Lyrics[Verse 1]
I never thought that you'd find out I did it
I was so scared that you would leave so I hid it
I know we said that we'd always be honest
So now I went out and messed up, our nest

It finally seems like we've turned into strangers
Its gotten so bad there's just no more anger
So now it seems like we can't get no further
I can't believe I'll be bright for another
[Chorus]
I'll be the switch she turns on
She'll be mine too, I get off
I'll be the fuse that she blows
And even with the lights out we'll glow

[Verse 2]
So where's the sun it shines no love on your face
Under the moon and with the girl that's in your place
And even Edison has no idea
Of all the blackouts I've caused you and me

[Chorus]
I'll be the switch she turns on
She'll be mine too, I get off
I'll be the fuse that she blows
And even with the lights out we'll glow
I'll be the switch she turns on
She'll be mine too, I get off
I'll be the fuse that she blows
And even with the lights down real low

[Interlude]
(we'll glow, we'll glow, we'll glowwwow)

[Guitar Solo]
You might also like[Chorus]
I'll be the switch she turns on
She'll be mine too, I get off
I'll be the, I'll be the fuse that she blows
And even with the lights out we'll glow
I'll be the switch she turns on
She'll be mine too, I get off
I'll be the fuse that she blows
And even with the lights out we'll glow
I'll be the switch she turns on
She'll be mine too, I get off
I'll be the fuse that she blows
And even with the lights out we'll glow

[Outro]
(I'll be the, I'll be the fuse)
(I'll be the, I'll be the fuse)1Embed
annotation:
[('And even Edison has no idea
 Of all the blackouts I’ve caused you and me', [['Nobody knows just how many arguments and fights that the singer has caused in his current relationship, as this isn’t the first big mistake he has made']]), ('Under the moon and with the girl that’s in your place', [['The singer knows that the next girl he dates will actually be able to love him no matter how many mistakes he makes and no matter the circumstances they’re in, unlike his current girlfriend']]), ('So where’s the sun it shines no love on your face', [['The singer’s girlfriend feels absolutely nothing for him, and he nothing for her, so the relationship is virtually over']]), ('And even with the lights out we’ll glow', [['The singer knows that in his next relationship, the two of them will be able to get through hard times together']]), ('I’ll be the switch she turns on
 She’ll be mine too, I get off
 I’ll be the fuse that she blows', [['This part is pretty sexual, and what he’s basically saying is that there will be a better physical connection between him and the next girl he’s with than there is in his current relationship']]), ('So now it seems like we can’t get no further
 I can’t believe I’ll be bright for another', [['Now that they’ve gotten through the arguments, the singer knows there is no future for the relationship, and is hopeful about his next relationship']]), ('It finally seems like we’ve turned into strangers
 Its gotten so bad there’s just no more anger', [['They’ve argued so much about what the singer has done that they barely know each other anymore, and there’s nothing left for them to argue about']]), ('I know we said that we’d always be honest', [['As a couple they promised each other complete honesty, and the singer has broken this promise, and now that his girlfriend has found out about it he can finally be honest again']]), ('I never thought that you’d find out I did it
 I was so scared that you would leave so I hid it', [['The singer has done something that he thinks would ruin his relationship so he hid it to avoid confrontation, and now his girl has found out about it']])]

title: These Days

And so are you

We'll be a real team
We'll be a real team

And so are you

annotation:
[('We’ll be a real team
 We’ll be a real team', [['By making efforts together, they can achieve the relationship they want']]), ('We’re growing cold
 It’s getting old', [['Whatever relations they still have with each other are coming to an end, and have been for a while']]), ('Playing all these games and
 I wonder who’s to blame it
 I sit and think it’s you, I’m sure the feelings mutual', [['The singer’s been losing control since his ex left, and he thinks that they’re the reason why, while his ex probably thinks that he’s the reason why instead']]), ('And so are you
 I think it’s something positive, and negative too', [['The singer’s ex has also been putting effort into their life, and he recognises how much they’ve improved as a person; but this also creates issues because he misses them and is having to see them flourish without him']]), ('Would you like to work with me, I’d love to work you', [['The singer is inviting the other person to work with him so they can be together, and despite the fact that he thinks he’s a challenge to be with (‘work you’) he is willing to put effort in']]), ('There’s work to do', [['If they were to ever get back together – which the singer wants – then they’d have to work hard to achieve the life they want with eachother']]), ('These days are great', [['The singer’s been working and his life has changed greatly since the two of them were with eachother']]), ('I’m seeing all you gave and
 It somehow don’t seem even close to what I’d do
 To break in two seems natural', [['He’s been thinking about all the person did for their relationship, and how it’s so different to both what he did and what he’d do now, and so their breakup was justified']]), ('I sit and think of you, I hope the feeling’s mutual', [['The singer has been thinking about somebody he was once involved with, and hopes that the person is doing the same about him']])]

annotation:
[('Habits are hard to break
 I don’t know how much I can take from you
 I guess that I’ll never relate
 I really don’t know what to make of you', [['The singer understands that it’s hard to break the cycle of an addiction, but as he has never been through it he really doesn’t know how to approach the situation, and is possibly a little bit scared of the process of helping an old friend to get better.']]), ('I talked to your parents yesterday
 It seems they’re doin’ fine
 They’re worried about you', [['Even though Sarah’s family are not affected physically by her addiction, they’re under a lot of stress worrying about how their daughter is doing']]), ('It seems like wasted time
 Cause you can only help yourself', [['Sarah is being offered help, but it will only benefit her if she accepts it and adjusts her mindset so that she can make the changes she needs to make']]), ('I know its been some time
 But now you’re back, I’ll try to help', [['Even though the singer hasn’t seen Sarah in a long time, now that she’s back in the neighbourhood, he’s willing to help and support her in any way that he can because she’s a childhood friend who he cares about']]), ('Now you’re coming down, Sarah', [['Now that Sarah has finally decided to stop taking heroin, she can finally see how awful her life has become, and how much hurt she has caused to herself and others']]), ('I can’t help you now, Sarah', [['Sarah has come so far in her addiction that words or actions from the singer can’t get her to stop, and she needs professional help instead, if she’s willing to take it']]), ('What the hell were you thinking of?', [['Because the singer has never been in Sarah’s situation, he doesn’t understand why she chose to take heroin in the first place, let alone continue to use it']]), ('Never thought you’d fly
 We all miss you', [['He thought she would stay in their town and progress through life as normal, but instead she has left and developed an addiction, which has caused her to alienate herself from people who care about her; both the singer and the community she was a part of']]), ('Back then I loved you', [['When the singer was young and spending a lot of time with Sarah he had feelings for her, and he might still have some, hence why he needs her to stop doing what she’s doing.']]), ('Remember when we were young?
 We’d smoke cigarettes behind the store
 Pimpin beers for fun', [['The singer and Sarah spent a lot of time together when they were young, and he cares a lot about her, which is why he’s so concerned about her current actions and choices']])]
